description: Conversion of existing outbuilding to Annex including associated changes to fenestration and installation 2no rooflights
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the materials specified on the approved plans and on the submitted application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The outbuilding to which this permission relates shall only be used for purposes ancillary to the use of 273 Malden Road as a single family dwellinghouse and shall not be used as an independent dwelling unless otherwise agreed in writing with the local planning authority.Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interests of satisfactory living conditions, and in the interests of the safety and operations of the highway network, in accordance with policies D3, D6 and T4 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
Fee - the pre-application fee will be confirmed once we receive further details of the proposal. The fee will be payable online via the Council website.

The assessment of this application is based on measurements taken from the submitted drawings / plans. If it transpires that the drawings / plans submitted are incorrect this would nullify the validity of this decision and you are advised to submit a fresh application with the correct information / drawings.
